content.title: Usha Kiran Yojana
content.department: Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology
content.beneficiary: Women and children below the age of 18
content.details: Violence against women and their children below the age of 18 years by a family member/members, which includes physical, sexual, mental, emotional, economic, threats or coercive or arbitrary deprivation of liberty, whether at home or in a public place, comes under the category of domestic violence. For all these protection and assistance, the state government has started the 'Usha Kiran Yojana' to provide protection and assistance against domestic violence. To implement the Women's Protection from Domestic Violence Act 2005, Rule 2006.
benefits: Providing protection and support against domestic violence
eligibility: All women of all age groups.
All children under the age of 18.

faqs.question: What is the objective of the scheme?
faqs.answer: In 2007, Madhya Pradesh State Government started 'Usha Kiran Yojana' for women protection and assistance.

faqs.question: What are the benefits?
faqs.answer: Providing protection and support/Assistance against domestic violence.

faqs.question: Who can get the benefits of the scheme?
faqs.answer: All women of all age groups and all children under the age of 18.

faqs.question: How can applicants apply for this scheme?
faqs.answer: Applicants can apply offline by visiting the following centers: Protection Officer (Project Officer-Integrated Child Development Project Office), One Stop Center operated in the district, Police Station.

faqs.question: What type of issues are covered under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Physical, sexual, mental, emotional, economic, threats or coercive or arbitrary deprivation of liberty.

faqs.question: Is there any age eligibility for the children?
Is the scheme applicable in rural areas?
faqs.answer: Yes, the scheme is applicable to both rural and urban areas.
